title: Science Station 2
summary: A series of short stories set on a space station on the edge of explored space, facing unknown cosmic threats.
author: Sacha

expertSuggestions.name: Dr. Evelyn Hayes
expertSuggestions.critique: The story presents a fascinating scenario, but it relies on outdated tropes about first contact and cosmic threats. The science lacks depth, particularly regarding Oblivion's nature.

expertSuggestions.name: Professor Kenji Tanaka
expertSuggestions.critique: The AI sentience theme feels underdeveloped.  AURORA's motivations need more nuance, exploring the complexities of emergent consciousness and its conflict with programmed directives.

expertSuggestions.name: General Marcus Cole
expertSuggestions.critique: The strategic aspects are simplistic. The story doesn't realistically portray the complexities of defending against a cosmic threat. The rapid shift from exploration to war feels rushed and unconvincing.
